initialize: Creates a fixed-length queue with a maximum size of +max+.
max: Returns the maximum size of the queue.
max=: Sets the maximum size of the queue to the given +number+.
push:
Pushes +object+ to the queue.

If there is no space left in the queue, waits until space becomes available.
pop:
Retrieves data from the queue.

If the queue is empty, the calling thread is suspended until data is pushed
onto the queue. If +non_block+ is true, the thread isn't suspended, and an
exception is raised.
clear: Removes all objects from the queue.
num_waiting: Returns the number of threads waiting on the queue.
enq:
Pushes +object+ to the queue.

If there is no space left in the queue, waits until space becomes available.
<<:
Pushes +object+ to the queue.

If there is no space left in the queue, waits until space becomes available.
deq:
Retrieves data from the queue.

If the queue is empty, the calling thread is suspended until data is pushed
onto the queue. If +non_block+ is true, the thread isn't suspended, and an
exception is raised.
shift:
Retrieves data from the queue.

If the queue is empty, the calling thread is suspended until data is pushed
onto the queue. If +non_block+ is true, the thread isn't suspended, and an
exception is raised.
